key_title: Key to the species of Wolffia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Lemnaceae

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Lemnaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1994). Lemnaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Thallus 0.2–0.5 mm wide (length to width ratio 1.6–3.5), depth twice to three times length of dorsal surface; dorsal surface whitish green, flat and sharply edged laterally, with 8–25 stomata

Thallus 0.3–0.8 mm wide (length to width ratio 1.3–2), depth up to twice length of dorsal (upper, emergent) surface; dorsal surface uniformly green and shining, distinctly convex and rounded laterally, with 50–80 stomata
